project.projectDescription: Video games are often thought of as child’s play, and that as people age, their performance in video games suffers. In order to see if there is any relationship between performance and player age, the player data for the game of FIFA 19 was examined and overall rating vs. Age was reviewed for a correlation.
project.dataDescription:
The dataset is all player data for FIFA19. It was extracted from Kaggle on March 3, 2019. The data describes each players character’s statistics and how well they have been playing soccer. To clean up the data and reduce the size to be manageable for this project, we extracted only users with a Nationality of ‘United States’ For this project, we extracted the columns of Age, Nationality, Overall, and Preferred.Foot. Overall which is a cumulative score of the player rating (their player performance).
There were no significant outliers to remove.
https://www.kaggle.com/karangadiya/fifa19
project.researchQuestion: Is there a linear association between the overall player rating in FIFA 19 and the age of the player, use alpha = 0.05?
project.conclusion: There appears to be a loose linear relationship between age and player performance. The correlation between age and the overall rating of a player is such that the older a player is the better they can be expected to be. However, it is not a strong correlation and no causation can be derived from this finding. Also, since this study was limited to one game and one country, other nationalities and games would need to be included in future studies to get a definitive finding.
